Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,397Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 25

Summary: It’s strange to watch him now, his jaw clenched as he looks over the battle plans for tomorrow. He’s so devoid of that easy, spoiled humour he’d known him for. He looks like a king, Merlin thinks, and it’s the first time he’s ever really thought that. When dealing with the fallout of Uther’s death, he’d been so consumed by the Arthurness of Arthur- his tangible grief, his fear and loyalty to his new crown- that he’d not spared much thought to how the world would see him now. The King of Camelot.Did the lantern by the door of the tent, the one behind him, make his head seem brighter somehow? Chosen, perhaps. Like the day they’d met.
